00051 static int iptables_do_command(const char *format, ...);
00052 static char *iptables_compile(const char *, const char *, const t_firewall_rule *);
00053 static void iptables_load_ruleset(const char *, const char *, const char *);
00054 
00055 extern pthread_mutex_t  client_list_mutex;
00056 extern pthread_mutex_t  config_mutex;
00057 
00060 static int fw_quiet = 0;
00061 
00070 static void
00071 iptables_insert_gateway_id(char **input)
00072 {
00073         char *token;
00074         const s_config *config;
00075         char *buffer;
00076 
00077         if (strstr(*input, "$ID$")==NULL)
00078                 return;
00079 
00080 
00081         while ((token=strstr(*input, "$ID$"))!=NULL)
00082                 /* This string may look odd but it's standard POSIX and ISO C */
00083                 memcpy(token, "%1$s", 4);
00084 
00085         config = config_get_config();
00086         safe_asprintf(&buffer, *input, config->gw_interface);
00087 
00088         free(*input);
00089         *input=buffer;
00090 }
00091 
00094 static int
00095 iptables_do_command(const char *format, ...)
00096 {
00097         va_list vlist;
00098         char *fmt_cmd;
00099         char *cmd;
00100         int rc;
00101 
00102         va_start(vlist, format);
00103         safe_vasprintf(&fmt_cmd, format, vlist);
00104         va_end(vlist);
00105 
00106         safe_asprintf(&cmd, "iptables %s", fmt_cmd);
00107         free(fmt_cmd);
00108 
00109         iptables_insert_gateway_id(&cmd);
00110 
00111         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Executing command: %s", cmd);
00112 
00113         rc = execute(cmd, fw_quiet);
00114 
00115         if (rc!=0) {
00116                 // If quiet, do not display the error
00117                 if (fw_quiet == 0)
00118                         debug(LOG_ERR, "iptables command failed(%d): %s", rc, cmd);
00119                 else if (fw_quiet == 1)
00120                         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "iptables command failed(%d): %s", rc, cmd);
00121         }
00122 
00123         free(cmd);
00124 
00125         return rc;
00126 }
00127 
00136         static char *
00137 iptables_compile(const char * table, const char *chain, const t_firewall_rule *rule)
00138 {
00139         char    command[MAX_BUF],
00140                 *mode;
00141 
00142         memset(command, 0, MAX_BUF);
00143 
00144         if (rule->block_allow == 1) {
00145                 mode = safe_strdup("ACCEPT");
00146         } else {
00147                 mode = safe_strdup("REJECT");
00148         }
00149 
00150         snprintf(command, sizeof(command),  "-t %s -A %s ",table, chain);
00151         if (rule->mask != NULL) {
00152                 snprintf((command + strlen(command)), (sizeof(command) - 
00153                                         strlen(command)), "-d %s ", rule->mask);
00154         }
00155         if (rule->protocol != NULL) {
00156                 snprintf((command + strlen(command)), (sizeof(command) -
00157                                         strlen(command)), "-p %s ", rule->protocol);
00158         }
00159         if (rule->port != NULL) {
00160                 snprintf((command + strlen(command)), (sizeof(command) -
00161                                         strlen(command)), "--dport %s ", rule->port);
00162         }
00163         snprintf((command + strlen(command)), (sizeof(command) - 
00164                                 strlen(command)), "-j %s", mode);
00165 
00166         free(mode);
00167 
00168         /* XXX The buffer command, an automatic variable, will get cleaned
00169          * off of the stack when we return, so we strdup() it. */
00170         return(safe_strdup(command));
00171 }
00172 
00180         static void
00181 iptables_load_ruleset(const char * table, const char *ruleset, const char *chain)
00182 {
00183         t_firewall_rule         *rule;
00184         char                    *cmd;
00185 
00186         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Load ruleset %s into table %s, chain %s", ruleset, table, chain);
00187 
00188         for (rule = get_ruleset(ruleset); rule != NULL; rule = rule->next) {
00189                 cmd = iptables_compile(table, chain, rule);
00190                 debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Loading rule \"%s\" into table %s, chain %s", cmd, table, chain);
00191                 iptables_do_command(cmd);
00192                 free(cmd);
00193         }
00194 
00195         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Ruleset %s loaded into table %s, chain %s", ruleset, table, chain);
00196 }
00197 
00198         void
00199 iptables_fw_clear_authservers(void)
00200 {
00201         iptables_do_command("-t filter -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00202         iptables_do_command("-t nat -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00203 }
00204 
00205         void
00206 iptables_fw_set_authservers(void)
00207 {
00208         const s_config *config;
00209         t_auth_serv *auth_server;
00210 
00211         config = config_get_config();
00212 
00213         for (auth_server = config->auth_servers; auth_server != NULL; auth_server = auth_server->next) {
00214                 if (auth_server->last_ip && strcmp(auth_server->last_ip, "0.0.0.0") != 0) {
00215                         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS " -d %s -j ACCEPT", auth_server->last_ip);
00216                         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS " -d %s -j ACCEPT", auth_server->last_ip);
00217                 }
00218         }
00219 
00220 }
00221 
00224         int
00225 iptables_fw_init(void)
00226 {
00227         const s_config *config;
00228         char * ext_interface = NULL;
00229         int gw_port = 0;
00230         t_trusted_mac *p;
00231 
00232         fw_quiet = 0;
00233 
00234         LOCK_CONFIG();
00235         config = config_get_config();
00236         gw_port = config->gw_port;
00237         if (config->external_interface) {
00238                 ext_interface = safe_strdup(config->external_interface);
00239         } else {
00240                 ext_interface = get_ext_iface();
00241         }
00242 
00243         if (ext_interface == NULL) {
00244                 UNLOCK_CONFIG();
00245                 debug(LOG_ERR, "FATAL: no external interface");
00246                 return 0;
00247         }
00248         /*
00249          *
00250          * Everything in the MANGLE table
00251          *
00252          */
00253 
00254         /* Create new chains */
00255         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_TRUSTED);
00256         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00257         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING);
00258 
00259         /* Assign links and rules to these new chains */
00260         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -I PREROUTING 1 -i %s -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING, config->gw_interface);
00261         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -I PREROUTING 1 -i %s -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_TRUSTED, config->gw_interface);//this rule will be inserted before the prior one
00262         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -I POSTROUTING 1 -o %s -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING, config->gw_interface);
00263 
00264         for (p = config->trustedmaclist; p != NULL; p = p->next)
00265                 iptables_do_command("-t mangle -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_TRUSTED " -m mac --mac-source %s -j MARK --set-mark %d", p->mac, FW_MARK_KNOWN);
00266 
00267         /*
00268          *
00269          * Everything in the NAT table
00270          *
00271          */
00272 
00273         /* Create new chains */
00274         iptables_do_command("-t nat -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00275         iptables_do_command("-t nat -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_ROUTER);
00276         iptables_do_command("-t nat -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET);
00277         iptables_do_command("-t nat -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00278         iptables_do_command("-t nat -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN);
00279         iptables_do_command("-t nat -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00280 
00281         /* Assign links and rules to these new chains */
00282         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A PREROUTING -i %s -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING, config->gw_interface);
00283 
00284         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING " -d %s -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_ROUTER, config->gw_address);
00285         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_ROUTER " -j ACCEPT");
00286 
00287         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING " -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET);
00288         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -m mark --mark 0x%u -j ACCEPT", FW_MARK_KNOWN);
00289         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -m mark --mark 0x%u -j ACCEPT", FW_MARK_PROBATION);
00290         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN);
00291 
00292         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN " -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00293         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN " -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00294         iptables_do_command("-t nat -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN " -p tcp --dport 80 -j REDIRECT --to-ports %d", gw_port);
00295 
00296 
00297         /*
00298          *
00299          * Everything in the FILTER table
00300          *
00301          */
00302 
00303         /* Create new chains */
00304         iptables_do_command("-t filter -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET);
00305         iptables_do_command("-t filter -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00306         iptables_do_command("-t filter -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_LOCKED);
00307         iptables_do_command("-t filter -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00308         iptables_do_command("-t filter -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_VALIDATE);
00309         iptables_do_command("-t filter -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_KNOWN);
00310         iptables_do_command("-t filter -N " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN);
00311 
00312         /* Assign links and rules to these new chains */
00313 
00314         /* Insert at the beginning */
00315         iptables_do_command("-t filter -I FORWARD -i %s -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET, config->gw_interface);
00316 
00317 
00318         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -m state --state INVALID -j DROP");
00319 
00320         /* XXX: Why this? it means that connections setup after authentication
00321            stay open even after the connection is done... 
00322            iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -m state --state RELATED,ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT");*/
00323 
00324         //Won't this rule NEVER match anyway?!?!? benoitg, 2007-06-23
00325         //iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -i %s -m state --state NEW -j DROP", ext_interface);
00326 
00327         /* TCPMSS rule for PPPoE */
00328         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -o %s -p tcp --tcp-flags SYN,RST SYN -j TCPMSS --clamp-mss-to-pmtu", ext_interface);
00329 
00330         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00331         iptables_fw_set_authservers();
00332 
00333         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -m mark --mark 0x%u -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_LOCKED, FW_MARK_LOCKED);
00334         iptables_load_ruleset("filter", "locked-users", TABLE_WIFIDOG_LOCKED);
00335 
00336         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00337         iptables_load_ruleset("filter", "global", TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00338         iptables_load_ruleset("nat", "global", TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00339 
00340         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -m mark --mark 0x%u -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_VALIDATE, FW_MARK_PROBATION);
00341         iptables_load_ruleset("filter", "validating-users", TABLE_WIFIDOG_VALIDATE);
00342 
00343         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -m mark --mark 0x%u -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_KNOWN, FW_MARK_KNOWN);
00344         iptables_load_ruleset("filter", "known-users", TABLE_WIFIDOG_KNOWN);
00345 
00346         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET " -j " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN);
00347         iptables_load_ruleset("filter", "unknown-users", TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN);
00348         iptables_do_command("-t filter -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN " -j REJECT --reject-with icmp-port-unreachable");
00349 
00350         UNLOCK_CONFIG();
00351         return 1;
00352 }
00353 
00358         int
00359 iptables_fw_destroy(void)
00360 {
00361         fw_quiet = 1;
00362 
00363         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Destroying our iptables entries");
00364 
00365         /*
00366          *
00367          * Everything in the MANGLE table
00368          *
00369          */
00370         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Destroying chains in the MANGLE table");
00371         iptables_fw_destroy_mention("mangle", "PREROUTING", TABLE_WIFIDOG_TRUSTED);
00372         iptables_fw_destroy_mention("mangle", "PREROUTING", TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00373         iptables_fw_destroy_mention("mangle", "POSTROUTING", TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING);
00374         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_TRUSTED);
00375         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00376         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING);
00377         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_TRUSTED);
00378         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00379         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING);
00380 
00381         /*
00382          *
00383          * Everything in the NAT table
00384          *
00385          */
00386         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Destroying chains in the NAT table");
00387         iptables_fw_destroy_mention("nat", "PREROUTING", TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00388         iptables_do_command("-t nat -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00389         iptables_do_command("-t nat -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00390         iptables_do_command("-t nat -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_ROUTER);
00391         iptables_do_command("-t nat -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET);
00392         iptables_do_command("-t nat -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00393         iptables_do_command("-t nat -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN);
00394         iptables_do_command("-t nat -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00395         iptables_do_command("-t nat -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00396         iptables_do_command("-t nat -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_ROUTER);
00397         iptables_do_command("-t nat -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET);
00398         iptables_do_command("-t nat -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00399         iptables_do_command("-t nat -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN);
00400 
00401         /*
00402          *
00403          * Everything in the FILTER table
00404          *
00405          */
00406         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Destroying chains in the FILTER table");
00407         iptables_fw_destroy_mention("filter", "FORWARD", TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET);
00408         iptables_do_command("-t filter -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET);
00409         iptables_do_command("-t filter -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00410         iptables_do_command("-t filter -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_LOCKED);
00411         iptables_do_command("-t filter -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00412         iptables_do_command("-t filter -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_VALIDATE);
00413         iptables_do_command("-t filter -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_KNOWN);
00414         iptables_do_command("-t filter -F " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN);
00415         iptables_do_command("-t filter -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_WIFI_TO_INTERNET);
00416         iptables_do_command("-t filter -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_AUTHSERVERS);
00417         iptables_do_command("-t filter -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_LOCKED);
00418         iptables_do_command("-t filter -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_GLOBAL);
00419         iptables_do_command("-t filter -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_VALIDATE);
00420         iptables_do_command("-t filter -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_KNOWN);
00421         iptables_do_command("-t filter -X " TABLE_WIFIDOG_UNKNOWN);
00422 
00423         return 1;
00424 }
00425 
00426 /*
00427  * Helper for iptables_fw_destroy
00428  * @param table The table to search
00429  * @param chain The chain in that table to search
00430  * @param mention A word to find and delete in rules in the given table+chain
00431  */
00432 int
00433 iptables_fw_destroy_mention(
00434                 const char * table,
00435                 const char * chain,
00436                 const char * mention
00437                 ) {
00438         FILE *p = NULL;
00439         char *command = NULL;
00440         char *command2 = NULL;
00441         char line[MAX_BUF];
00442         char rulenum[10];
00443         char *victim = safe_strdup(mention);
00444         int deleted = 0;
00445 
00446         iptables_insert_gateway_id(&victim);
00447 
00448         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Attempting to destroy all mention of %s from %s.%s", victim, table, chain);
00449 
00450         safe_asprintf(&command, "iptables -t %s -L %s -n --line-numbers -v", table, chain);
00451         iptables_insert_gateway_id(&command);
00452 
00453         if ((p = popen(command, "r"))) {
00454                 /* Skip first 2 lines */
00455                 while (!feof(p) && fgetc(p) != '\n');
00456                 while (!feof(p) && fgetc(p) != '\n');
00457                 /* Loop over entries */
00458                 while (fgets(line, sizeof(line), p)) {
00459                         /* Look for victim */
00460                         if (strstr(line, victim)) {
00461                                 /* Found victim - Get the rule number into rulenum*/
00462                                 if (sscanf(line, "%9[0-9]", rulenum) == 1) {
00463                                         /* Delete the rule: */
00464                                         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Deleting rule %s from %s.%s because it mentions %s", rulenum, table, chain, victim);
00465                                         safe_asprintf(&command2, "-t %s -D %s %s", table, chain, rulenum);
00466                                         iptables_do_command(command2);
00467                                         free(command2);
00468                                         deleted = 1;
00469                                         /* Do not keep looping - the captured rulenums will no longer be accurate */
00470                                         break;
00471                                 }
00472                         }
00473                 }
00474                 pclose(p);
00475         }
00476 
00477         free(command);
00478         free(victim);
00479 
00480         if (deleted) {
00481                 /* Recurse just in case there are more in the same table+chain */
00482                 iptables_fw_destroy_mention(table, chain, mention);
00483         }
00484 
00485         return (deleted);
00486 }
00487 
00489         int
00490 iptables_fw_access(fw_access_t type, const char *ip, const char *mac, int tag)
00491 {
00492         int rc;
00493 
00494         fw_quiet = 0;
00495 
00496         switch(type) {
00497                 case FW_ACCESS_ALLOW:
00498                         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING " -s %s -m mac --mac-source %s -j MARK --set-mark %d", ip, mac, tag);
00499                         rc = iptables_do_command("-t mangle -A " TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING " -d %s -j ACCEPT", ip);
00500                         break;
00501                 case FW_ACCESS_DENY:
00502                         iptables_do_command("-t mangle -D " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING " -s %s -m mac --mac-source %s -j MARK --set-mark %d", ip, mac, tag);
00503                         rc = iptables_do_command("-t mangle -D " TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING " -d %s -j ACCEPT", ip);
00504                         break;
00505                 default:
00506                         rc = -1;
00507                         break;
00508         }
00509 
00510         return rc;
00511 }
00512 
00514         int
00515 iptables_fw_counters_update(void)
00516 {
00517         FILE *output;
00518         char *script,
00519              ip[16],
00520              rc;
00521         unsigned long long int counter;
00522         t_client *p1;
00523         struct in_addr tempaddr;
00524 
00525         /* Look for outgoing traffic */
00526         safe_asprintf(&script, "%s %s", "iptables", "-v -n -x -t mangle -L " TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00527         iptables_insert_gateway_id(&script);
00528         output = popen(script, "r");
00529         free(script);
00530         if (!output) {
00531                 debug(LOG_ERR, "popen(): %s", strerror(errno));
00532                 return -1;
00533         }
00534 
00535         /* skip the first two lines */
00536         while (('\n' != fgetc(output)) && !feof(output))
00537                 ;
00538         while (('\n' != fgetc(output)) && !feof(output))
00539                 ;
00540         while (output && !(feof(output))) {
00541                 rc = fscanf(output, "%*s %llu %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s %15[0-9.] %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s", &counter, ip);
00542                 //rc = fscanf(output, "%*s %llu %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s %15[0-9.] %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s 0x%*u", &counter, ip);
00543                 if (2 == rc && EOF != rc) {
00544                         /* Sanity*/
00545                         if (!inet_aton(ip, &tempaddr)) {
00546                                 debug(LOG_WARNING, "I was supposed to read an IP address but instead got [%s] - ignoring it", ip);
00547                                 continue;
00548                         }
00549                         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Read outgoing traffic for %s: Bytes=%llu", ip, counter);
00550                         LOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00551                         if ((p1 = client_list_find_by_ip(ip))) {
00552                                 if ((p1->counters.outgoing - p1->counters.outgoing_history) < counter) {
00553                                         p1->counters.outgoing = p1->counters.outgoing_history + counter;
00554                                         p1->counters.last_updated = time(NULL);
00555                                         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "%s - Updated counter.outgoing to %llu bytes.  Updated last_updated to %d", ip, counter, p1->counters.last_updated);
00556                                 }
00557                         } else {
00558                                 debug(LOG_ERR, "iptables_fw_counters_update(): Could not find %s in client list, this should not happen unless if the gateway crashed", ip);
00559                                 debug(LOG_ERR, "Preventively deleting firewall rules for %s in table %s", ip, TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00560                                 iptables_fw_destroy_mention("mangle", TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING, ip);
00561                                 debug(LOG_ERR, "Preventively deleting firewall rules for %s in table %s", ip, TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING);
00562                                 iptables_fw_destroy_mention("mangle", TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING, ip);
00563                         }
00564                         UNLOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00565                 }
00566         }
00567         pclose(output);
00568 
00569         /* Look for incoming traffic */
00570         safe_asprintf(&script, "%s %s", "iptables", "-v -n -x -t mangle -L " TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING);
00571         iptables_insert_gateway_id(&script);
00572         output = popen(script, "r");
00573         free(script);
00574         if (!output) {
00575                 debug(LOG_ERR, "popen(): %s", strerror(errno));
00576                 return -1;
00577         }
00578 
00579         /* skip the first two lines */
00580         while (('\n' != fgetc(output)) && !feof(output))
00581                 ;
00582         while (('\n' != fgetc(output)) && !feof(output))
00583                 ;
00584         while (output && !(feof(output))) {
00585                 rc = fscanf(output, "%*s %llu %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s %15[0-9.]", &counter, ip);
00586                 if (2 == rc && EOF != rc) {
00587                         /* Sanity*/
00588                         if (!inet_aton(ip, &tempaddr)) {
00589                                 debug(LOG_WARNING, "I was supposed to read an IP address but instead got [%s] - ignoring it", ip);
00590                                 continue;
00591                         }
00592                         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Read incoming traffic for %s: Bytes=%llu", ip, counter);
00593                         LOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00594                         if ((p1 = client_list_find_by_ip(ip))) {
00595                                 if ((p1->counters.incoming - p1->counters.incoming_history) < counter) {
00596                                         p1->counters.incoming = p1->counters.incoming_history + counter;
00597                                         debug(LOG_DEBUG, "%s - Updated counter.incoming to %llu bytes", ip, counter);
00598                                 }
00599                         } else {
00600                                 debug(LOG_ERR, "iptables_fw_counters_update(): Could not find %s in client list, this should not happen unless if the gateway crashed", ip);
00601                                 debug(LOG_ERR, "Preventively deleting firewall rules for %s in table %s", ip, TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING);
00602                                 iptables_fw_destroy_mention("mangle", TABLE_WIFIDOG_OUTGOING, ip);
00603                                 debug(LOG_ERR, "Preventively deleting firewall rules for %s in table %s", ip, TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING);
00604                                 iptables_fw_destroy_mention("mangle", TABLE_WIFIDOG_INCOMING, ip);
00605                         }
00606                         UNLOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00607                 }
00608         }
00609         pclose(output);
00610 
00611         return 1;
00612 }
